newsitem.title: UNITED NATIONS: Libya sponsors Farrakhan news conference at UN.
newsitem.headline: Libya sponsors Farrakhan news conference at UN.

text.p: Libya is sponsoring Wednesday's news conference at the United Nations by Louis Farrakhan, the controversial U.S. Black Moslem leader.

A formal news conference at the United Nations requires the approval of a government or U.N. body and in this case Libya backed Farrakhan, the cleric who leads the Nation of Islam in the United States, a U.N. spokesman said.
Thousands of Farrakhan's supporters gathered on Wednesday on streets surrounding the United Nations to commemorate the one-year anniversary of the Million Man March on Washington.
One theme of the rally is a call for nations of the world to atone for injustices, wars and violence.

Farrakhan recently visited Libya, Cuba, Iraq, Iran, Nigeria and Sudan. While in Libya, he received a $250,000 human rights award, an apparent violation of U.S. law which prohibits financial dealings with Libya because of its alleged sponsorship of international terrorism.
The U.S. Treasury Department has denied Farrakhan's application to receive either the $250,000 or an additional $1 billion that Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi had pledged to the Nation of Islam.
